alert.note: Alert for Lee; Phillips (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 11:55PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Lee and Phillips Counties through 1230 AM CST... At 1155 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Palmer to St. Charles to near De Witt. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marianna, Marvell, Elaine, White River National Wildlife Refuge, Helena-West Helena, Lexa, Rondo, Aubrey, Watkins Corner, Lake View, Lagrange, Jeffersonville, Wabash, Modoc, Haleside, Hoop Spur, Soudan, Wycamp, Latour and Turkey Scratch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for eastern Arkansas...and northwestern Mississippi.
